briefTitle: Aprepitant- and Olanzapine- Containing Anti-emetic Regimens With High Dose Melphalan

armGroups.label: Aprepitant
interventionNames: Drug: o Aprepitant 125 mg orally one hour prior to chemotherapy on Day -1 and 80 mg orally on Days 0 and +1

armGroups.label: Olanzapine
interventionNames: Drug: Olanzapine10 mg orally daily on Days -1,0,+1 and +2

interventions.name: o Aprepitant 125 mg orally one hour prior to chemotherapy on Day -1 and 80 mg orally on Days 0 and +1
Olanzapine10 mg orally daily on Days -1,0,+1 and +2

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Autologous transplant containing high dose melphalan as part of the conditioning regimen (single or 2 day melphalan; BEAM \[carmustine, etoposide, cytarabine, melphalan\])
* able to tolerate oral medications

Exclusion Criteria:

* Nausea/vomiting within 12 hours before planned high dose conditioning chemotherapy
* Any anti-emetic treatment within 24 hours before planned high dose conditioning chemotherapy
* Pregnancy
* Baseline corrected QT interval (QTc) \> 500 ms
* History of seizures
* History of central nervous system (CNS) disease
* Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)

outcomeMeasures.title: Complete Response (CR)
outcomeMeasures.description: no emesis and no rescue anti-emetic therapy

outcomeMeasures.title: Acute Complete Response
outcomeMeasures.description: no emesis or rescue therapy; Acute complete response defined as no emesis or rescue therapy required from time point of 0 to 24 hours following melphalan therapy administration

outcomeMeasures.title: Delayed Complete Response
outcomeMeasures.description: no emesis or rescue therapy administered; Delayed complete response defined as no emesis or rescue therapy required from time point of 25 hours to 120 hours following melphalan therapy administration
